intro: Eutropia, commonly known as the silverleaf dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, surrounded by pale green bracts. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, giving it a silvery appearance. Eutropia is often found in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
